definitions.definition: To make extinct; to extinguish or annihilate.
Extinguished, no longer alight (of fire, candles etc.)
definitions.example: Poor Edward's cigarillo was already extinct.
Luckily, such ideas about race are extinct in current sociological theory.

definitions.definition: (of a group of organisms, as a species) No longer in existence; having died out.
definitions.example: The dinosaurs have been extinct for millions of years.
Most of the volcanos on this island are now extinct.
